page.title: 10LAMPUGH HALL FARM
page.content: At Lamplugh Hall there are 151 cows. The breeds are Friesian, a Blonde Aquataine Bull and a Welsh Black Bull. From 1 cow in a day they get 36 litres but in a year they get 5060 litres. They fatten cows to auction at Cockermouth or Carlisle. They sell bulls at 18 months to 2 years and keep female cows for milking. The cows are milked twice a day at 6.00 in the morning and 4.00 in the afternoon. They milk their cows in a herring-bone parlour which milks 16 at a time. For milking they wear an overcoat and wellies. On the farm they have 2 silage pits and 3 cubicle houses. One house holds 130 cows. The dairy herd No. is U5777. There are 5 workers on the farm who all have their own jobs. They have a 131 acres at the farm, most of the land is used for grazing, silage or barley.
